content.description: Begin with the thin crack that has 2 bolts. Move right to a higher crack with takes you to the roof. Up and over.
content.location: On the back side is a large overhang.  A thin crack is on the right side.

content.description: Find a crack 10 feet off the ground with a bolt protecting the move into the crack. Crux is getting into the crack.
content.protection: 1 bolt and the rest is trad gear.
content.location: In the middle of the rock. Find the bolt. Decent - Off to climbers left is 2 bolt anchor on top of Dwight's Roof.

content.description: Kevin H is researching with his Bozeman friends to figure out who did the FA and the rating.  Terry Kennedy wrote the book  "In Search of the Mount Cleveland Five" and how the group and the Dirty Sox Club spent time in the Humbug.  Have to say I liked the book.
content.location: On the roof side - Up the hill from Alex's Route (left).  Thinking it's 30 to 40 feet.  Bolts.

content.description: Like the Alex Route, climb to the overhand 20 feet up. Climb the overhang and stay left in the crack.
content.protection: Trad gear. Bolted anchors on top.
content.location: 20 to 25 feet left of the inside (and end) of the Dwight Crack project. There is a small overhang 20 feet up. The Elton's Route crack goes left (The Alex's Route goes right onto the face).

content.description: Just a top rope. Crux is the roof but will mention there is a knee lock in the middle.
content.location: Back side of Friend's Rock. Middle of the Overhand. One bolt at end of roof on the headwall.

content.description:
This is an open project. Just too much to do.

Climb the crack in the roof going from the far left side to meet up with Dwight's Roof (in the middle). I think the headwall above the roof will need 3 (?) bolts. I was going to put a belay anchor under the roof to help with rope drag, but ended up working on Alex's Route that day.
Pitch 1 is the wide crack. Climb to the belay ledge with bolt anchor. Pitch 2 is a bolted sport route to the top.
content.location: The wide crack is left of Nate's Route.

content.description: Use the right crack to get into the longer crack on the left. Climb to the skyline access route and continue to the anchor on top of Dwight's Roof.
content.location: On the left side of the front "wedge" side are 2 cracks.

content.description: Climb 20 feet to a small overhang. Climb the overhang and move right to bolts. Face climb the bolts to the top.
content.protection: Trad gear and bolts. Anchor bolts on top.
content.location: 20 to 25 feet left of the inside (and end) of the Dwight Crack project. There is a small overhang 20 feet up. The Alex's Route goes right onto the face(The Elton's Route crack goes left).
